channel.title: How do i add the option to change slayer task?
channel.description: I really need help my slayer npc only gives slayer tasks and dosnt have the option to change it any help?. thanks. I ALREADY TYED GOOGLE DONT TELL ME TO GOOGLE IT

item.title: How do i add the option to change slayer task?
item.dc:creator: @weed4u weed4u
item.description:
@weed4u wrote:

[quote=“P A N I C, post:4, topic:389478”]if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("taskreset") { slayerTask = 0; sM("You have reset your slayer task!"); }[/quote]
thats the smae thing i have if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("resettask")) { taskID = 0; sM("Slayer Task reset!"); }
except its taskID because thats the variable for it help?

Read full topic

item.source: How do i add the option to change slayer task?

item.title: How do i add the option to change slayer task?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

You could reset the value which the slayer NPC adds to, example, when you speak to the NPC the vale “slayer task” gets set to 1 (ufdetc) by IO. You can reset that value.

e.g


if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("resetask") {
slayerTask = 0; //var could be diff
sM("Task reset!");
}

Please take into account the fact the variables could be different. You could also incorporate this with object clicking and talking to an NPC by reseting the value. The command was just a base of concept, I’ll leave you to do the rest

An example for object clicking would be

if (objectID == ID) {
slayertask = 0;
//possible dialogue?
sM("reset");
}

Obviously, they then get a task of the person again, unless you have a specific value for tasks? You could then implement a misc.random system. Look at your current method of giving the player a task.

Also, you didn’t try Google, because I found one

Read full topic
